KH.content: khōra as abyss, mise en abyme, gaping hole, not exactly chaos or fright, but not Gaia, foundation, either > abyss in encyclopedic logic [of Timaeus], regulates all sites (lieux) on its edges (jobs in society, region, territory, country)
KH.linkedContent: khōra as abyss, mise en abyme, gaping hole, not exactly chaos or fright, but not Gaia, foundation, either > abyss in encyclopedic logic [of Timaeus], regulates all sites (lieux) on its edges (jobs in society, region, territory, country)

KH.content: Heidegger: chaos, khaos, khaine, signifies the yawning, a split in two, close connection to aletheia, abyss which opens
KH.linkedContent: Heidegger: chaos, khaos, khaine, signifies the yawning, a split in two, close connection to aletheia, abyss which opens

KH.content: for Nietzsche, Chaos prevents a humanization (Vermenschung) of existence in its totality
KH.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, Chaos prevents a humanization (Vermenschung) of existence in its totality

KH.content: mise en abyme of discourse on khōra, site of politics, politics of sites; and other that would not be their other [Hegel’s other]
KH.linkedContent: mise en abyme of discourse on khōra, site of politics, politics of sites; and other that would not be their other [Hegel’s other]

KH.content: Derrida less concerned w/ art of Plato [re: mises en abyme of khōra and politics] but in a constraint, a programme, the being-programme of the programme, the being-logical of logic: Plato apprehends them as such, though in a dream, put en abyme
KH.linkedContent: Derrida less concerned w/ art of Plato [re: mises en abyme of khōra and politics] but in a constraint, a programme, the being-programme of the programme, the being-logical of logic: Plato apprehends them as such, though in a dream, put en abyme

KH.content: Socrates puts himself in place of khōra (place itself, irreplaceable and unplaceable place), thus makes them, makes us talk, implacably [no choice] [see pp. 121-22 Socrates seems to program discourse of his addressees, who will speak?]
KH.linkedContent: Socrates puts himself in place of khōra (place itself, irreplaceable and unplaceable place), thus makes them, makes us talk, implacably [no choice] [see pp. 121-22 Socrates seems to program discourse of his addressees, who will speak?]

KH.content: is Socrates someone, something, play of proper names more abyssal than ever, “who are you, Khōra?”
KH.linkedContent: is Socrates someone, something, play of proper names more abyssal than ever, “who are you, Khōra?”

KH.content: en abyme reflected w/out limit, feeling of dizziness, up against inside face of what wall: chaos, chasm, khōra
KH.linkedContent: en abyme reflected w/out limit, feeling of dizziness, up against inside face of what wall: chaos, chasm, khōra

KH.content: abyss of khōra doesn’t open all at once, fracture of abyss announced in muted, subterranean way, preparing, propagating simulacra & mises en abymes
KH.linkedContent: abyss of khōra doesn’t open all at once, fracture of abyss announced in muted, subterranean way, preparing, propagating simulacra & mises en abymes

KH.content: btwn text & theme, structure w/out an indivisible origin > theater of irony, w/out end, w/out bottom [abyss]; to isolate a theme, “philosophy-of-Plato,” would be to violently misrecognize, deny textual scene, questions of topology in general
KH.linkedContent: btwn text & theme, structure w/out an indivisible origin > theater of irony, w/out end, w/out bottom [abyss]; to isolate a theme, “philosophy-of-Plato,” would be to violently misrecognize, deny textual scene, questions of topology in general

GOD.content: European history gets lost in details, doesn’t think abyss at heart of history that prevents totalization, misunderstands link btwn historicity & responsibility
GOD.linkedContent: European history gets lost in details, doesn’t think abyss at heart of history that prevents totalization, misunderstands link btwn historicity & responsibility

GOD.content: literature, place of secrets w/out secrecy, all these crypts w/out depth, no other basis than abyss of call or address; only law: singularity of event called the work (l’oeuvre)
GOD.linkedContent: literature, place of secrets w/out secrecy, all these crypts w/out depth, no other basis than abyss of call or address; only law: singularity of event called the work (l’oeuvre)

GT.content: “another border already divided itself in indefinite abyssal supplements”

Icarus racing toward sun [via Baudelaire], sinking (sombre) not toward the bottom (fond) but toward abyss; unable to give his name, how could he ever claim he knows how to give? has no sepulture thus no proper name > the whole story? all of history?
GT.linkedContent: Icarus racing toward sun [via Baudelaire], sinking (sombre) not toward the bottom (fond) but toward abyss; unable to give his name, how could he ever claim he knows how to give? has no sepulture thus no proper name > the whole story? all of history?

AF.content: indetermination en abyme when Yerushalmi in-determines Jewishness & science one by the other
AF.linkedContent: indetermination en abyme when Yerushalmi in-determines Jewishness & science one by the other

POO.content: duplicity in a ceremony, being-double, “hollows itself out in an infinite abyss:” one is neither friendly nor polite if one obeys the rules
POO.linkedContent: duplicity in a ceremony, being-double, “hollows itself out in an infinite abyss:” one is neither friendly nor polite if one obeys the rules

POO.content: the duplicity before the rule makes one tremble, an other who will seek to hold you back or push you into void, save you or lose you, supposing there ever a choice?
POO.linkedContent: the duplicity before the rule makes one tremble, an other who will seek to hold you back or push you into void, save you or lose you, supposing there ever a choice?

SPOM.content: good conscience loses chance of abyssal desert, “desert in desert,” chaotic desert as open mouth, coming of other (messianic: ineffaceable mark of Marx’s legacy) [see p. 209]
SPOM.linkedContent: good conscience loses chance of abyssal desert, “desert in desert,” chaotic desert as open mouth, coming of other (messianic: ineffaceable mark of Marx’s legacy) [see p. 209]

POR.content: abyss, hole, Abgrund, empty “gorge”: impossibility for a principle of grounding (reason) to ground itself
POR.linkedContent: abyss, hole, Abgrund, empty “gorge”: impossibility for a principle of grounding (reason) to ground itself

POR.content: strategic rhythm of new [professorial?] responsibility: multiple sites (lieux), rhythm of blinking eye (d’un battement de paupières), play one risk off other, la clôture contre l’abîme, l’abîme contre la clôture [hard eye (of reason) has no rhythm, no heart beat, no arrêt of sur-vie]
POR.linkedContent: strategic rhythm of new [professorial?] responsibility: multiple sites (lieux), rhythm of blinking eye (d’un battement de paupières), play one risk off other, la clôture contre l’abîme, l’abîme contre la clôture [hard eye (of reason) has no rhythm, no heart beat, no arrêt of sur-vie]

MPM.content: if memory maneuvers btwn law and Being, can one think the being and law of memory? these questions move through transference & translation, above abyss; require impossible passageways: “the fragile resistance of a span” [hymen?]
MPM.linkedContent: if memory maneuvers btwn law and Being, can one think the being and law of memory? these questions move through transference & translation, above abyss; require impossible passageways: “the fragile resistance of a span” [hymen?]

POOF.content: [Schmitt has just led us to the abyss of the partisan] Derrida feigns restraint, one can only speak of the abyss from the shore, then he screams, swallows all assurance, voiceless talk of politics: Rwanda, Italy, ex-Yugoslavia, Palestine, Cambodia, Ukraine, the ‘Clipper’ chip…
POOF.linkedContent: [Schmitt has just led us to the abyss of the partisan] Derrida feigns restraint, one can only speak of the abyss from the shore, then he screams, swallows all assurance, voiceless talk of politics: Rwanda, Italy, ex-Yugoslavia, Palestine, Cambodia, Ukraine, the ‘Clipper’ chip…

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s hermit too attracted to the depths, nostalgic for elevation—dreams of a friend to gain altitude > friend’s nostalgia: wish to believe in other, wishing in vain to believe in ourselves > Derrida links this nostalgia to the Heideggerian nostalgia at origin of philosophical philía: elle nourrit [fires?] donc l’envie à l’égard de l’autre comme de nous-mêmes, we envy each other, love as the attempt to leap beyond this envy
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s hermit too attracted to the depths, nostalgic for elevation—dreams of a friend to gain altitude > friend’s nostalgia: wish to believe in other, wishing in vain to believe in ourselves > Derrida links this nostalgia to the Heideggerian nostalgia at origin of philosophical philía: elle nourrit [fires?] donc l’envie à l’égard de l’autre comme de nous-mêmes, we envy each other, love as the attempt to leap beyond this envy

A.content: abyssal inquiry re: Heidegger’s delimitation of death, modes of ending, more than one limit, ends of man an indestructable (increvable) subject > death of Dasein not end of man, btwn the 2 there’s a divisible limit, perhaps, of ending, place where ending ends [?]
A.linkedContent: abyssal inquiry re: Heidegger’s delimitation of death, modes of ending, more than one limit, ends of man an indestructable (increvable) subject > death of Dasein not end of man, btwn the 2 there’s a divisible limit, perhaps, of ending, place where ending ends [?]

EM.content: Heidegger destroys privilege of present-now (Gegenwart) by way of a presence (Anwesen, Anwesenheit) which 3 modes of present (present-present, past-present, future-present) can’t exhaust > provides playing space (l’espace de jeu) on basis of the fourfold (On Time and Being), “an alternative always suspended over its ‘own proper’ abysm”: it is the text of dissemination
EM.linkedContent: Heidegger destroys privilege of present-now (Gegenwart) by way of a presence (Anwesen, Anwesenheit) which 3 modes of present (present-present, past-present, future-present) can’t exhaust > provides playing space (l’espace de jeu) on basis of the fourfold (On Time and Being), “an alternative always suspended over its ‘own proper’ abysm”: it is the text of dissemination

SEC.content: general possibility of “parasite”: 1) trap (piège), failure (échec), abyss outside/in front of language, ditch (fossé), place of external perdition, which language can avoid, sheltered by (à l’abri de) its essence or telos? 2) or is this risk, internal and positive condition of its possibility, this outside its inside?
SEC.linkedContent: general possibility of “parasite”: 1) trap (piège), failure (échec), abyss outside/in front of language, ditch (fossé), place of external perdition, which language can avoid, sheltered by (à l’abri de) its essence or telos? 2) or is this risk, internal and positive condition of its possibility, this outside its inside?

SEC.content: Austin makes us accept as ordinary a teleological and ethical determination > univocality of statement, self presence of total context, transparency of intentions, presence of meaning—absolute singular oneness of speech act
SEC.linkedContent: Austin makes us accept as ordinary a teleological and ethical determination > univocality of statement, self presence of total context, transparency of intentions, presence of meaning—absolute singular oneness of speech act

S.content: Heidegger on Trakl’s avoidance (vermeiden) of word “geistig”: is contrary opposed to material, names abyss (abîme, Kluft) btwn suprasensible (noeton) & sensible (aistheton) > Heidegger is condemning the degradation of “spiritual” into the “rational,” “intellectual,” “ideological”
S.linkedContent: Heidegger on Trakl’s avoidance (vermeiden) of word “geistig”: is contrary opposed to material, names abyss (abîme, Kluft) btwn suprasensible (noeton) & sensible (aistheton) > Heidegger is condemning the degradation of “spiritual” into the “rational,” “intellectual,” “ideological”

PAS.content: near depthless abyss in mise en scène of “Viens”
PAS.linkedContent: near depthless abyss in mise en scène of “Viens”

FWT.content: logic of exemplarity leads to an abyss (figurality undermines the entire question) [re: those w/ self-hatred resembling Jews]
FWT.linkedContent: logic of exemplarity leads to an abyss (figurality undermines the entire question) [re: those w/ self-hatred resembling Jews]

WM.content: TN. Bass gives a good account of mettre en abyme alongside abîmer: the former an endless reflection (heraldic term, escutcheon and on), the latter the ruination or plunging into abyss > “figurative of ruination”: when distinction btwn reflected/reflecting falls apart
WM.linkedContent: TN. Bass gives a good account of mettre en abyme alongside abîmer: the former an endless reflection (heraldic term, escutcheon and on), the latter the ruination or plunging into abyss > “figurative of ruination”: when distinction btwn reflected/reflecting falls apart

DS.content: a system that is closed-in on itself would be checked by a safety-catch (un cran d’arrêt)——wrong to interpret Mallarmé’s Mimique as oriented toward its abysses, its false bottoms, as if they were pretextual referents > a writing that refers back only to itself is some other writing
DS.linkedContent: a system that is closed-in on itself would be checked by a safety-catch (un cran d’arrêt)——wrong to interpret Mallarmé’s Mimique as oriented toward its abysses, its false bottoms, as if they were pretextual referents > a writing that refers back only to itself is some other writing

DS.content: hymen is not a phenomenon—it folds itself back into the antre, which is an abyss
DS.linkedContent: hymen is not a phenomenon—it folds itself back into the antre, which is an abyss

DS.content: mark upon mark, text w/in text, margin in mark (endless repeat): an abyss
DS.linkedContent: mark upon mark, text w/in text, margin in mark (endless repeat): an abyss

DS.content: writing en abyme, abyss will never have glint (l’éclat) of phenomenon > becomes white or black, l’un et/ou l’autre au carré de l’écriture
DS.linkedContent: writing en abyme, abyss will never have glint (l’éclat) of phenomenon > becomes white or black, l’un et/ou l’autre au carré de l’écriture

DS.content: opposition btwn metaphor & metonymy is purely semantic—deconstructed by superficial, profound, that is abyssal operation of versification (vers, vers—sens—vers, versus, verre), morcelante et reconstituante (hiver, pervers, envers, travers, vertige, rêve)
DS.linkedContent: opposition btwn metaphor & metonymy is purely semantic—deconstructed by superficial, profound, that is abyssal operation of versification (vers, vers—sens—vers, versus, verre), morcelante et reconstituante (hiver, pervers, envers, travers, vertige, rêve)

P.content: the circle & the abyss: circle en abyme
is there an abyss in Hegel? (circle in a circle not necessarily abyssal) for there to be an abyss the smallest circle would have to inscribe in itself the figure of the largest [es gibt, il y a]
P.linkedContent: is there an abyss in Hegel? (circle in a circle not necessarily abyssal) for there to be an abyss the smallest circle would have to inscribe in itself the figure of the largest [es gibt, il y a]

P.content: all this talk of circles has drawn us toward the abyss, abyss can come to saturate what it hollows it
P.linkedContent: all this talk of circles has drawn us toward the abyss, abyss can come to saturate what it hollows it

P.content: undecidability of abyss: bottom-less & bottom of bottom, “filling up the abyss” > satire of abyss, comic effect
P.linkedContent: undecidability of abyss: bottom-less & bottom of bottom, “filling up the abyss” > satire of abyss, comic effect

P.content: Kant looking for a bridge from sensible to supersensible (an analogy), a symbol—that crosses/closes abyss
P.linkedContent: Kant looking for a bridge from sensible to supersensible (an analogy), a symbol—that crosses/closes abyss

P.content: bridge (Brücke) not an analogy, concept/effect of analogy makes the bridge itself
P.linkedContent: bridge (Brücke) not an analogy, concept/effect of analogy makes the bridge itself

P.content: analogy of abyss & bridge over abyss require 3rd term, that which heals the gap, a symbol, bridge is symbol, symbol bridge > abyss calls for analogy (active resource of Critique), mais l’analogie s’abîme sans fin dès lors qu’il faut bien un certain art pour décrire analogiquement le jeu de l’analogie
P.linkedContent: analogy of abyss & bridge over abyss require 3rd term, that which heals the gap, a symbol, bridge is symbol, symbol bridge > abyss calls for analogy (active resource of Critique), mais l’analogie s’abîme sans fin dès lors qu’il faut bien un certain art pour décrire analogiquement le jeu de l’analogie

P.content: economize on the abyss: 1) textual art of reprise, s’épargner la chute en tissant et repliant à l’infini le tissu, multiply patches (pièces) 2) abyssal operation (formalize rules, constrain logic, reappropriate): work toward rèleve & that in it which regularly reproduces collapse
P.linkedContent: economize on the abyss: 1) textual art of reprise, s’épargner la chute en tissant et repliant à l’infini le tissu, multiply patches (pièces) 2) abyssal operation (formalize rules, constrain logic, reappropriate): work toward rèleve & that in it which regularly reproduces collapse

P.content: Kant: very depths of foundations (Grundlage) of faculty of principles is independent of experience, otherwise it might sink and bring w/ it ruin (Einsturz) > Kant descends to bythos of abyss w/out knowing if it exists
P.linkedContent: Kant: very depths of foundations (Grundlage) of faculty of principles is independent of experience, otherwise it might sink and bring w/ it ruin (Einsturz) > Kant descends to bythos of abyss w/out knowing if it exists

P.content: desire of reason, desire for the fundamental: desire to go to the bythos
P.linkedContent: desire of reason, desire for the fundamental: desire to go to the bythos

P.content: Kant: examples are wheelchairs (Gängelwagen) [roulettes] of judgment, those who don’t have enough Mutterwitz, the sick, need these wheelchairs, prostheses that replace nothing
P.linkedContent: Kant: examples are wheelchairs (Gängelwagen) [roulettes] of judgment, those who don’t have enough Mutterwitz, the sick, need these wheelchairs, prostheses that replace nothing

P.content: Hegel: there is play in examples, they play, Beispielen
P.linkedContent: Hegel: there is play in examples, they play, Beispielen

P.content: Derrida, via Hegel: examples divert energy of ergon, introduce chance & abyss into necessity of Mutterwitz > this can make one lose one’s head, a Russian roulette (death drive and mourning of labor in experience of beautiful), to put into play pleasure w/out enjoyment
P.linkedContent: Derrida, via Hegel: examples divert energy of ergon, introduce chance & abyss into necessity of Mutterwitz > this can make one lose one’s head, a Russian roulette (death drive and mourning of labor in experience of beautiful), to put into play pleasure w/out enjoyment

P.content: death’s essential relation to the cut, the hiatus of the abyss, where beauty takes us by surprise
P.linkedContent: death’s essential relation to the cut, the hiatus of the abyss, where beauty takes us by surprise

P.content: in Kant, art of man analogized with art of creator (unity of empirical laws), man has goal before operating, this effaces a priori the sans, the pure cut of free beauty
P.linkedContent: in Kant, art of man analogized with art of creator (unity of empirical laws), man has goal before operating, this effaces a priori the sans, the pure cut of free beauty

P.content: connection btwn anthropo-theologism & analogism: course being steered [Spinoza says something quite tangential in Ethics], analogy w/ practical finality is its medium
P.linkedContent: connection btwn anthropo-theologism & analogism: course being steered [Spinoza says something quite tangential in Ethics], analogy w/ practical finality is its medium

P.content: analogism saturates hiatus by repetition: mise en abyme resists the abyss of collapse, reconstitutes economy of mimesis (economimesis), l’analogisme recapitule ou recapite
P.linkedContent: analogism saturates hiatus by repetition: mise en abyme resists the abyss of collapse, reconstitutes economy of mimesis (economimesis), l’analogisme recapitule ou recapite

ROP.content: going from 3rd to 4th, or from 2 to endless & bottomless divisibility [Mephistophelic word]
ROP.linkedContent: going from 3rd to 4th, or from 2 to endless & bottomless divisibility [Mephistophelic word]

SP.content: Heidegger’s abyssal structure of the proper, at once superficial & bottomless (since not fundamental), the proper founders, passes into the other
SP.linkedContent: Heidegger’s abyssal structure of the proper, at once superficial & bottomless (since not fundamental), the proper founders, passes into the other

SP.content: (das Eigentum des Ab-grundes) the proper-ty of the abyss, the abyss of proper-ty, the reorganization of metaphysics around more powerful question of propriation, question of event (Ereignis) uprooted from ontology, where proper is proper to no one, to nothing: is this what Nietzsche’s woman is, style’s form: the no-where, gift as woman’s essential predicate, appears in undecidable oscillation btwn give/take, se donner/se donner-pour > price/value of pharmakon
SP.linkedContent: (das Eigentum des Ab-grundes) the proper-ty of the abyss, the abyss of proper-ty, the reorganization of metaphysics around more powerful question of propriation, question of event (Ereignis) uprooted from ontology, where proper is proper to no one, to nothing: is this what Nietzsche’s woman is, style’s form: the no-where, gift as woman’s essential predicate, appears in undecidable oscillation btwn give/take, se donner/se donner-pour > price/value of pharmakon

SP.content: plus d’un spur, never been the woman > if there’s going to be style, pour que le simulacrum advienne, il faut écrire dans l’écart entre plusieurs styles: anchor lost in abyss btwn—telle est l’échéance
SP.linkedContent: plus d’un spur, never been the woman > if there’s going to be style, pour que le simulacrum advienne, il faut écrire dans l’écart entre plusieurs styles: anchor lost in abyss btwn—telle est l’échéance

ATIA.content: discussion is interesting [re: animals] once limit is abyssal (rather than limit as discontinuity): once frontier is not a single, indivisible line, but more than one internally divided lines (folds, foliations): “what are the edges of a limit that feed on an abyss?”
ATIA.linkedContent: discussion is interesting [re: animals] once limit is abyssal (rather than limit as discontinuity): once frontier is not a single, indivisible line, but more than one internally divided lines (folds, foliations): “what are the edges of a limit that feed on an abyss?”

ATIA.content: via Valéry’s snake, the “animal abyss” is not a void, it’s too full of being, vertigo, étincelle au lieu de néant, lieu tenant du néant que je suis
ATIA.linkedContent: via Valéry’s snake, the “animal abyss” is not a void, it’s too full of being, vertigo, étincelle au lieu de néant, lieu tenant du néant que je suis

ATIA.content: the abyss of autos, ipseity, autokinesis: we must surrender (get) to the heart of the abyss btwn law of nature (reaction) & law of freedom (response & responsibility)
ATIA.linkedContent: the abyss of autos, ipseity, autokinesis: we must surrender (get) to the heart of the abyss btwn law of nature (reaction) & law of freedom (response & responsibility)

ATIA.content: question of response, question of question, where response to question would remain unprogrammable > abyss of “what is a response?”
ATIA.linkedContent: question of response, question of question, where response to question would remain unprogrammable > abyss of “what is a response?”

ATIA.content: for Lacan, move from animal to human (to speech, to truth, to symbolic order): abyssal concept of a feined feint or pretended pretense (not merely the figure or simple feint)
ATIA.linkedContent: for Lacan, move from animal to human (to speech, to truth, to symbolic order): abyssal concept of a feined feint or pretended pretense (not merely the figure or simple feint)

SW.content: theory (beyond theory) of fetishism at moment of verdict, w/ whole history engaged in it (Freud, Exodus, St. Paul, the en abyme of un ver à soie), thought of the event w/out revealed/unveiled truth, w/out phallogocentrism, w/out greco-judeo-paulino-islamo-freud-heidggeriano-lacanian [no christiano!] veil, w/out (un)veiling of phallus
SW.linkedContent: theory (beyond theory) of fetishism at moment of verdict, w/ whole history engaged in it (Freud, Exodus, St. Paul, the en abyme of un ver à soie), thought of the event w/out revealed/unveiled truth, w/out phallogocentrism, w/out greco-judeo-paulino-islamo-freud-heidggeriano-lacanian [no christiano!] veil, w/out (un)veiling of phallus

TB.content: rhythm, twists & turns from abyss to abyss, deconstructs the tower > madness on both sides (interior/exterior limit) > impossible task: the infinite guilt absolves you immediately
TB.linkedContent: rhythm, twists & turns from abyss to abyss, deconstructs the tower > madness on both sides (interior/exterior limit) > impossible task: the infinite guilt absolves you immediately

DPi.content: we've asked “what is an exception?” “what is cruelty?” “blood?” “man?” “proper to man?” “to humanitarian?” > neither rhetorical nor answerable, these questions  showed “the vertigo or the abyss of their own impossibility” > nor did they simply recreate dizziness of hermeneutic circle (which they also did) which accumulates meaning, supposes pre-comprehension [link to imagining the phone call, imminence of verdict]
DPi.linkedContent: we've asked “what is an exception?” “what is cruelty?” “blood?” “man?” “proper to man?” “to humanitarian?” > neither rhetorical nor answerable, these questions showed “the vertigo or the abyss of their own impossibility” > nor did they simply recreate dizziness of hermeneutic circle (which they also did) which accumulates meaning, supposes pre-comprehension [link to imagining the phone call, imminence of verdict]

Gii.content: everything Heidegger says about man takes on meaning and value w/in oppositional limit to animal (it is dogmatic and serious)
Gii.linkedContent: everything Heidegger says about man takes on meaning and value w/in oppositional limit to animal (it is dogmatic and serious)

Gii.content: man’s hand infinitely removed from prehensile organs through the abyss of its being “durch einen Abgrund des Wesens”
Gii.linkedContent: man’s hand infinitely removed from prehensile organs through the abyss of its being “durch einen Abgrund des Wesens”

REST.content: for Heidegger, metaphorical (?) ground, this is the originary and fundamental experience of the Greeks, more than hypokeimenon > the underneath of the underneath (le dessous du dessous): a thinking of the abyss not mis-en-abyme
REST.linkedContent: for Heidegger, metaphorical (?) ground, this is the originary and fundamental experience of the Greeks, more than hypokeimenon > the underneath of the underneath (le dessous du dessous): a thinking of the abyss not mis-en-abyme

REST.content: abyss: “un des lieux ou non-lieux prêts à tout porter de ce jeu”
REST.linkedContent: abyss: “un des lieux ou non-lieux prêts à tout porter de ce jeu”

REST.content: how that which is under hypokeimenon opens an abyss (change of direction) > a completely different topic: “more” carries away, thing no longer has value/figure of “underneath”
REST.linkedContent: how that which is under hypokeimenon opens an abyss (change of direction) > a completely different topic: “more” carries away, thing no longer has value/figure of “underneath”

REST.content: Derrida wonders if topos of abyss (a fortiori mis-en-abyme) might dampen (amortir) the angular necessity of this other topic, other pas: undecidables, la figure du voilement, du linge voilant, l’hymen, la soquette ou le bas, entre pied et chaussure
REST.linkedContent: Derrida wonders if topos of abyss (a fortiori mis-en-abyme) might dampen (amortir) the angular necessity of this other topic, other pas: undecidables, la figure du voilement, du linge voilant, l’hymen, la soquette ou le bas, entre pied et chaussure

REST.content: gift, abyss, offering, there is abyss > essence of Van Gogh’s painting, via Heidegger’s Origin, opens onto an abyss (not attributive certainty, secure ground of [Cartesian-Hegelian] subjectivity)
REST.linkedContent: gift, abyss, offering, there is abyss > essence of Van Gogh’s painting, via Heidegger’s Origin, opens onto an abyss (not attributive certainty, secure ground of [Cartesian-Hegelian] subjectivity)

REST.content: Origin an essay on the gift (Schenkung), one of 3 senses in which truth is said to come to its installation, institution, investiture (Stiftung), there’s also the “founding (Gründen)” > this truth which is also nontruth also opens onto the “abyss”
REST.linkedContent: Origin an essay on the gift (Schenkung), one of 3 senses in which truth is said to come to its installation, institution, investiture (Stiftung), there’s also the “founding (Gründen)” > this truth which is also nontruth also opens onto the “abyss”

REST.content: for Heidegger, in Origin, the abyss (Abgrund) plays itself out like “veiled” destiny (fatum) which transfixes (transit) being
REST.linkedContent: for Heidegger, in Origin, the abyss (Abgrund) plays itself out like “veiled” destiny (fatum) which transfixes (transit) being

REST.content: Shapiro treats shoes as reproduction of real shoes, misses that, for Heidegger, shoes don’t relate to given subjectum, or given world, he won’t be able to avoid the bridge, doesn’t know shoes’re already prosthetic—précipitée dans l’abîme, la sphinge, dès l’instant où l’enflure (turgidity)
REST.linkedContent: Shapiro treats shoes as reproduction of real shoes, misses that, for Heidegger, shoes don’t relate to given subjectum, or given world, he won’t be able to avoid the bridge, doesn’t know shoes’re already prosthetic—précipitée dans l’abîme, la sphinge, dès l’instant où l’enflure (turgidity)

REST.content: that the shoes can always be someone else’s: “to be in someone’s shoes [in English]”
REST.linkedContent: that the shoes can always be someone else’s: “to be in someone’s shoes [in English]”

REST.content: affect of Van Gogh’s painting: army of ghosts demanding their shoes, bottomless memory of a dispossession
REST.linkedContent: affect of Van Gogh’s painting: army of ghosts demanding their shoes, bottomless memory of a dispossession

REST.content: painting as detachment that loses its footing, says nothing of mise-en-abyme: mise-en-abyme as restituting saturation > “painting in painting”
REST.linkedContent: painting as detachment that loses its footing, says nothing of mise-en-abyme: mise-en-abyme as restituting saturation > “painting in painting”

REST.content: [re: the interlaced correspondence]: interminable overflowing of whole, la surenchère en plus-value de la correspondance débordante (subordante), occurs btwn general element (discourse, writing, painting) & particular determinate element > element worth more than whole, and whole plays the part [metonymy/synechdoche no longer what they are]
REST.linkedContent: [re: the interlaced correspondence]: interminable overflowing of whole, la surenchère en plus-value de la correspondance débordante (subordante), occurs btwn general element (discourse, writing, painting) & particular determinate element > element worth more than whole, and whole plays the part [metonymy/synechdoche no longer what they are]

REST.content: what’s essential for Heidegger is making the overflowing appear by “earth,” “shoes,” “world” > il faudrait les ressaisir à l’instant où le hors-d’usage détaché (relativement déstricturé) donne lieu, a sort of abyssal surplus value, une surenchère sans fond > we can speak of conditions of fetishization of product/work, surplus value forms a truth-effect, useless gives way to speculative exploitation, more than useful (plus qu’utile): useful for grasping usefulness of useful [cf. pp. 339-41 double/triple uselessness (work, product, useless for grasping usefulness)]
REST.linkedContent: what’s essential for Heidegger is making the overflowing appear by “earth,” “shoes,” “world” > il faudrait les ressaisir à l’instant où le hors-d’usage détaché (relativement déstricturé) donne lieu, a sort of abyssal surplus value, une surenchère sans fond > we can speak of conditions of fetishization of product/work, surplus value forms a truth-effect, useless gives way to speculative exploitation, more than useful (plus qu’utile): useful for grasping usefulness of useful [cf. pp. 339-41 double/triple uselessness (work, product, useless for grasping usefulness)]

REST.content: when the detached calls for reattachment: a discourse is sketched, maneuver to call for adherence
REST.linkedContent: when the detached calls for reattachment: a discourse is sketched, maneuver to call for adherence

DST.content: to lose track of Darstellung is to lose track of abyssal structure that can always divide & fictionalize it [it being Darstellung?] [re: Lacoue-Labarthe on Heidegger’s use of Gestell]
DST.linkedContent: to lose track of Darstellung is to lose track of abyssal structure that can always divide & fictionalize it [it being Darstellung?] [re: Lacoue-Labarthe on Heidegger’s use of Gestell]

DST.content: fold or abyssal redoubling: désistance is first of all the désistance of truth: truth never resembles itself, so it resembles mimesis
DST.linkedContent: fold or abyssal redoubling: désistance is first of all the désistance of truth: truth never resembles itself, so it resembles mimesis

DST.content: désistance: mimesis or its double, cela même qu’elle double et abîme (what it doubles & engulfs)— alētheia
DST.linkedContent: désistance: mimesis or its double, cela même qu’elle double et abîme (what it doubles & engulfs)— alētheia

DST.content: for Heidegger, opposition btwn inadequate/adequate circumscribed by alētheia’s withdrawal—yet, Lacoue-Labarthe’s mimesis haunts alētheia w/ unstable homoiōsis ——abyss of pre-originary mimesis, “precedes” truth, introduces desire for homoiōsis > Derrida explains how, w/ this thinking, Lacoue-Labarthe dislocates Heidegger’s epochal history
DST.linkedContent: for Heidegger, opposition btwn inadequate/adequate circumscribed by alētheia’s withdrawal—yet, Lacoue-Labarthe’s mimesis haunts alētheia w/ unstable homoiōsis ——abyss of pre-originary mimesis, “precedes” truth, introduces desire for homoiōsis > Derrida explains how, w/ this thinking, Lacoue-Labarthe dislocates Heidegger’s epochal history

PIO.content: sponge-towel (serviette-éponge), emblematic story of my name as story of the other, blazon (mise en abyme) of “impossible subject,” fable, another way to make history
PIO.linkedContent: sponge-towel (serviette-éponge), emblematic story of my name as story of the other, blazon (mise en abyme) of “impossible subject,” fable, another way to make history

RM.content: metaphysical unity of opposition determined only “starting from (à partir de)” the re-trait of the trait > the “starting from” s’y abîme lui-même
RM.linkedContent: metaphysical unity of opposition determined only “starting from (à partir de)” the re-trait of the trait > the “starting from” s’y abîme lui-même

AFR.content: Condillac’s failure to go straight to principle of order, a fault of composition: he did not go straight to it > following order = discovering order: s’abyme, encircles history w/ nature
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac’s failure to go straight to principle of order, a fault of composition: he did not go straight to it > following order = discovering order: s’abyme, encircles history w/ nature

AFR.content: to introduce: seduce the text (not the reader), surprise it close to its content > a rigorous “abyss”
AFR.linkedContent: to introduce: seduce the text (not the reader), surprise it close to its content > a rigorous “abyss”

IW.content: Rosenzweig sees Cohen as a philosopher-teacher who reminds us of the abyssal risk of thought or existence
IW.linkedContent: Rosenzweig sees Cohen as a philosopher-teacher who reminds us of the abyssal risk of thought or existence

IW.content: Rosenzweig associates abyss w/ volcanic fire (eruption), convulsive tremor marking rhythm of flow of lava—tempo of discontinuous rhetoric
IW.linkedContent: Rosenzweig associates abyss w/ volcanic fire (eruption), convulsive tremor marking rhythm of flow of lava—tempo of discontinuous rhetoric

PSSS.content: btwn performative institution and constative knowledge an absolute hiatus, absolute cut, structure of indirectness, hiatus like a mouth that speaks or wound that bleeds
PSSS.linkedContent: btwn performative institution and constative knowledge an absolute hiatus, absolute cut, structure of indirectness, hiatus like a mouth that speaks or wound that bleeds

PSSS.content: this discontinuity calls for a leap, what Classical humanist philosophers call freedom, this interruption gives a chance
PSSS.linkedContent: this discontinuity calls for a leap, what Classical humanist philosophers call freedom, this interruption gives a chance

D.content: double bottom, “theaters of memory,” deprives square of ground (suspended in air)
D.linkedContent: double bottom, “theaters of memory,” deprives square of ground (suspended in air)

D.content: through mirror-effect (germinates/deforms), each sequence of text comprehends another > each part smaller than themselves & greater than the whole they reflect
D.linkedContent: through mirror-effect (germinates/deforms), each sequence of text comprehends another > each part smaller than themselves & greater than the whole they reflect

D.content: figure of quadrangle complicated by strange mirror [imparfait de double fond], mirror as echo that precedes origin it seems to answer > “echo” is an “incision” (X n’étant constitués qu’en retour)
D.linkedContent: figure of quadrangle complicated by strange mirror [imparfait de double fond], mirror as echo that precedes origin it seems to answer > “echo” is an “incision” (X n’étant constitués qu’en retour)

D.content: imperfect, certain aorist, certain unlimitedness, “unreachable double bottom (double-fond insaisissable)”: past of an anterior future, future of an anterior past
D.linkedContent: imperfect, certain aorist, certain unlimitedness, “unreachable double bottom (double-fond insaisissable)”: past of an anterior future, future of an anterior past

D.content: in Soller’s Numbers, you are indefinitely referred to bottomlessness, indefinite regress of beginning, which is forbidden along w/ eschatology, archeology, hermeneutic teleology
D.linkedContent: in Soller’s Numbers, you are indefinitely referred to bottomlessness, indefinite regress of beginning, which is forbidden along w/ eschatology, archeology, hermeneutic teleology

D.content: text occupies place before “me,” announces me to myself—une tour de guet (watchtower) planted inside me > like a “transparent column,” pure outside: driven into that which tries to close in on itself > imagine you swallowed a cylindrical mirror, tower of Babel, bottomless plurality, not negative…also phallic [p. 342 in Zohar: “great, ungraspable columns of air”]
D.linkedContent: text occupies place before “me,” announces me to myself—une tour de guet (watchtower) planted inside me > like a “transparent column,” pure outside: driven into that which tries to close in on itself > imagine you swallowed a cylindrical mirror, tower of Babel, bottomless plurality, not negative…also phallic [p. 342 in Zohar: “great, ungraspable columns of air”]

D.content: thickness (l’épaisseur) of text opens upon beyond of a whole, nothing or absolute outside: its depth (sa profondeur) at once null & infinite—each layer (couche) harbors (en abrite) another
D.linkedContent: thickness (l’épaisseur) of text opens upon beyond of a whole, nothing or absolute outside: its depth (sa profondeur) at once null & infinite—each layer (couche) harbors (en abrite) another

D.content: au bord (du vertige), alert to the border itself, infinite depths were also bottomless, perfectly superficial, cube w/out depth
D.linkedContent: au bord (du vertige), alert to the border itself, infinite depths were also bottomless, perfectly superficial, cube w/out depth

HST.content: unsolvable, vertiginous depth of sans-fond, irresistible whirlpool that carries forgiveness, gift, re-giving, re-dealing of forgiveness, to the abyss of the impossible
HST.linkedContent: unsolvable, vertiginous depth of sans-fond, irresistible whirlpool that carries forgiveness, gift, re-giving, re-dealing of forgiveness, to the abyss of the impossible

HST.content: abyss of non-response to aporetic question: condition of responsibility
HST.linkedContent: abyss of non-response to aporetic question: condition of responsibility

+R.content: what happens when a surplus value places itself en abyme?
+R.linkedContent: what happens when a surplus value places itself en abyme?

+R.content: the phrase “what both cuts me off and prompts me (me souffle) w/ all the rest” performs, does what it says it’s doing: framing borders are jumped, margins saturated en abyme
+R.linkedContent: the phrase “what both cuts me off and prompts me (me souffle) w/ all the rest” performs, does what it says it’s doing: framing borders are jumped, margins saturated en abyme

+R.content: into (over) the bargain (the market) (par-dessus le marché), not au-dessus (above) the market (the lure in which you would again let yourself be caught) > puts in play, or en abyme, the destructive simulacra of surplus value
+R.linkedContent: into (over) the bargain (the market) (par-dessus le marché), not au-dessus (above) the market (the lure in which you would again let yourself be caught) > puts in play, or en abyme, the destructive simulacra of surplus value

+R.content: en abyme [of representational reproduction] deports referential naiveté [re: Benjamin, comprise btwn painting/photography]
+R.linkedContent: en abyme [of representational reproduction] deports referential naiveté [re: Benjamin, comprise btwn painting/photography]

C.content: “don’t deliver them from fascination just when they’re falling into the abyss of the infinite—yet nil—distance, the outsize (démesuré) space”
C.linkedContent: “don’t deliver them from fascination just when they’re falling into the abyss of the infinite—yet nil—distance, the outsize (démesuré) space”

C.content: Derrida refers to the modesty of stopping at 127, of saying “that’s enough” > satis, sufficient, “satire of the abyss”
C.linkedContent: Derrida refers to the modesty of stopping at 127, of saying “that’s enough” > satis, sufficient, “satire of the abyss”

C.content: supplement of consequence contains everything, including abyss
bottomless surplus value: power of capitalization in abyss

TN.content: for Nancy, the Thing touches itself when one touches nothing: exact hyperbole (Nancy’s writing) engulfs, exscribes itself (s’ex-crit), s’abîme (sinks)
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, the Thing touches itself when one touches nothing: exact hyperbole (Nancy’s writing) engulfs, exscribes itself (s’ex-crit), s’abîme (sinks)

TN.content: for Berkeley, infinite abyss btwn what we see and what we touch
TN.linkedContent: for Berkeley, infinite abyss btwn what we see and what we touch

TN.content: for Nancy, touching the limit > moment of decision
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, touching the limit > moment of decision

TN.content: philosophy, literally, has never touched anything > inversely, all one ever does is touch a limit (destiny of this figurality) [hymen]; to touch is to touch a limit, a surface, a border, an outline
TN.linkedContent: philosophy, literally, has never touched anything > inversely, all one ever does is touch a limit (destiny of this figurality) [hymen]; to touch is to touch a limit, a surface, a border, an outline

TN.content: touch untouchable-touchable surface/border/limit on exposing edge of an abyss
TN.linkedContent: touch untouchable-touchable surface/border/limit on exposing edge of an abyss

TN.content: philosophy will have “touched” something 2x: limit & unfoundable abyss beneath/beyond it
TN.linkedContent: philosophy will have “touched” something 2x: limit & unfoundable abyss beneath/beyond it

TN.content: there can only be a figure of touch, one only touches by way of figure > the object, the touchable thing, the "thing itself,” is the untouchable (gives itself, opens only in history of figure)
TN.linkedContent: there can only be a figure of touch, one only touches by way of figure > the object, the touchable thing, the "thing itself,” is the untouchable (gives itself, opens only in history of figure)

TN.content: Derrida defends Husserl’s stubborn conviction that we can’t know alter-ego, only through analogy, appresentation, that there’s an unbridgeable abyss (abîme infranchissable) > Husserl’s stance prevents risk of an immediate intutionism of the other
TN.linkedContent: Derrida defends Husserl’s stubborn conviction that we can’t know alter-ego, only through analogy, appresentation, that there’s an unbridgeable abyss (abîme infranchissable) > Husserl’s stance prevents risk of an immediate intutionism of the other

TN.content: logic of limit [hymen?]: what lets itself be touched does so on its edge (sur son bord), thus it doesn’t let itself be touched/reached (ne se laisse pas atteindre)—exposing untouchable itself, the other edge of the edge (l’autre bord du bord)
TN.linkedContent: logic of limit [hymen?]: what lets itself be touched does so on its edge (sur son bord), thus it doesn’t let itself be touched/reached (ne se laisse pas atteindre)—exposing untouchable itself, the other edge of the edge (l’autre bord du bord)

TN.content: eyes meet, infinitely, mouths in contact [unsatisfied w/ insipid figures, however interesting/necessary], thought begins, jusqu’à l’abîme, plunging Narcissus into abyss: makes day or night possible > day and night themselves promising each other, au point du jour
TN.linkedContent: eyes meet, infinitely, mouths in contact [unsatisfied w/ insipid figures, however interesting/necessary], thought begins, jusqu’à l’abîme, plunging Narcissus into abyss: makes day or night possible > day and night themselves promising each other, au point du jour

AD.content: silence comes to us from abyss; (Kings 19:12-15) “sheer silence”
AD.linkedContent: silence comes to us from abyss; (Kings 19:12-15) “sheer silence”

AD.content: discern edges of abyss: it’s not necessarily a bad abyss
AD.linkedContent: discern edges of abyss: it’s not necessarily a bad abyss

CF.content: must forgiveness saturate the abyss (suture, reconcile)? but who could object to imperative of reconciliation? amnesties, work of mourning—political strategy, psycho-therapeutic economy
CF.linkedContent: must forgiveness saturate the abyss (suture, reconcile)? but who could object to imperative of reconciliation? amnesties, work of mourning—political strategy, psycho-therapeutic economy

CF.content: when not insoluble, when I know what to do (program), no decision or responsibility
CF.linkedContent: when not insoluble, when I know what to do (program), no decision or responsibility

CF.content: an abyss remains and must remain

BSi.content: “who” and “what” sink into indifference, into the abyss of who-becoming-what (death)—becoming what we will have always been
BSi.linkedContent: “who” and “what” sink into indifference, into the abyss of who-becoming-what (death)—becoming what we will have always been

BSi.content: talk of the bottom (fond), the profound, believing in depth [of “who” or “what”] will never be free from bêtise (stupidity) > sovereign & beast as bottomless bottom, abyss, vertigo
BSi.linkedContent: talk of the bottom (fond), the profound, believing in depth [of “who” or “what”] will never be free from bêtise (stupidity) > sovereign & beast as bottomless bottom, abyss, vertigo

BSi.content: if bêtise is not an error [Deleuze’s stance], no pragamatic use of bêtise does not refer (if obscurely) to abyss of jus (justice, justness, judge) [not faulty judgment but judgment of judge, judgment from which one expects some justness]
BSi.linkedContent: if bêtise is not an error [Deleuze’s stance], no pragamatic use of bêtise does not refer (if obscurely) to abyss of jus (justice, justness, judge) [not faulty judgment but judgment of judge, judgment from which one expects some justness]

BSi.content: Celan: “whoever walks on his head has heaven beneath him as an abyss (Abgrund)”
BSi.linkedContent: Celan: “whoever walks on his head has heaven beneath him as an abyss (Abgrund)”

BSi.content: abyss not a bottom or bottomless depth of hidden base > if there is abyss, there’s plus d’un sol, plus d’un seul seuil, plus d’un seul seul [(no) more (than one) solid, single threshold, single single]
BSi.linkedContent: abyss not a bottom or bottomless depth of hidden base > if there is abyss, there’s plus d’un sol, plus d’un seul seuil, plus d’un seul seul [(no) more (than one) solid, single threshold, single single]

OG.content: the horizontality of spacing, hollow of differance, discontinuity and discreteness (does not oppose it(self) like surface to depth), a hinge (brisure) marking impossibility of full speech
OG.linkedContent: the horizontality of spacing, hollow of differance, discontinuity and discreteness (does not oppose it(self) like surface to depth), a hinge (brisure) marking impossibility of full speech

OG.content: Derrida not denying certain roles of writing, but to attribute them to writing specifically and then to exempt speech: “il y a un abîme qu’on ne doit pas franchir aussi allègrement”
OG.linkedContent: Derrida not denying certain roles of writing, but to attribute them to writing specifically and then to exempt speech: “il y a un abîme qu’on ne doit pas franchir aussi allègrement”

OG.content: Rousseau: no intermediary btwn everything & nothing, must substitute
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau: no intermediary btwn everything & nothing, must substitute

OG.content: supplement as chain itself, theory of textuality, en abyme, structural necessity of abyss, desire of presence born in abyss
OG.linkedContent: supplement as chain itself, theory of textuality, en abyme, structural necessity of abyss, desire of presence born in abyss

OG.content: the dangerous differance, the master name of this supplementary series: death > metonymic substitution horizon & source, abyss from which each threat announces itself
OG.linkedContent: the dangerous differance, the master name of this supplementary series: death > metonymic substitution horizon & source, abyss from which each threat announces itself

OG.content: “l’abîme, c’est le creux qui peut rester ouvert entre la défaillance de la nature et le retard du supplément” [abyss as delay, hollow, open]; pure law restores (gives back to people) liberty, gives back to presence its sovereignty [sutures abyss], pure law a supplement of supplement
OG.linkedContent: “l’abîme, c’est le creux qui peut rester ouvert entre la défaillance de la nature et le retard du supplément” [abyss as delay, hollow, open]; pure law restores (gives back to people) liberty, gives back to presence its sovereignty [sutures abyss], pure law a supplement of supplement

OG.content: Vico’s 2nd form of writing: heroic emblem [en abyme]

SPEC.content: Derrida never wanted to abuse abyss or mise “en abyme,” wary of confidence it inspires fundamentally, too representative to go far enough (pour aller assez loin), or to not avoid the very thing toward which it allegedly rushes (pour ne pas éviter cela même vers quoi elle prétend précipiter)
SPEC.linkedContent: Derrida never wanted to abuse abyss or mise “en abyme,” wary of confidence it inspires fundamentally, too representative to go far enough (pour aller assez loin), or to not avoid the very thing toward which it allegedly rushes (pour ne pas éviter cela même vers quoi elle prétend précipiter)

SPEC.content: still, en abyme of Freud’s writing [re: autobiography in fort/da narrative] has relation of structural mimesis w/ relation btwn PP & “its” death drive—latter hollows out the former en abyme, at origin of origin
SPEC.linkedContent: still, en abyme of Freud’s writing [re: autobiography in fort/da narrative] has relation of structural mimesis w/ relation btwn PP & “its” death drive—latter hollows out the former en abyme, at origin of origin

SPEC.content: an abyss of more than one generation [Freud & Ernst] (also said about computers), an a priori of an aftereffect (d’un après-coup) [Derrida doing this too?] > formal structure se donne à lire once objects can substitute for each other (laying bare substitutive structure itself)
SPEC.linkedContent: an abyss of more than one generation [Freud & Ernst] (also said about computers), an a priori of an aftereffect (d’un après-coup) [Derrida doing this too?] > formal structure se donne à lire once objects can substitute for each other (laying bare substitutive structure itself)

SPEC.content: autobiographics of Beyond…, of word beyond [common name], imprints a prescription on fort:da, an overlapping (rapporté) by means of which proximity distances itself en abyme (Ent-fernung)
SPEC.linkedContent: autobiographics of Beyond…, of word beyond [common name], imprints a prescription on fort:da, an overlapping (rapporté) by means of which proximity distances itself en abyme (Ent-fernung)

SPEC.content: speculation [beyond PP], investment made by borrowing, no possibility of amortization, no reconciliation by coins, signs, and their telos—promise more than can provide [formula of love?], insolvent—infinite debt, unpayable, thus beyond debt, violates economy of equivalence (not economy in general)
SPEC.linkedContent: speculation [beyond PP], investment made by borrowing, no possibility of amortization, no reconciliation by coins, signs, and their telos—promise more than can provide [formula of love?], insolvent—infinite debt, unpayable, thus beyond debt, violates economy of equivalence (not economy in general)

SPEC.content: death drive & repetition compulsion suck Freud into abyss of PP, always adding a supplement of abyss beneath his steps (movement of trans-)
SPEC.linkedContent: death drive & repetition compulsion suck Freud into abyss of PP, always adding a supplement of abyss beneath his steps (movement of trans-)

FV.content: literature that puts truth on stage, can it be read by psychoanalysis? abyssal structure, this space overflowed by powers of simulacrum
FV.linkedContent: literature that puts truth on stage, can it be read by psychoanalysis? abyssal structure, this space overflowed by powers of simulacrum

FV.content: in Lacan, abyss effects are seriously controlled; fiction [only] manifests truth
FV.linkedContent: in Lacan, abyss effects are seriously controlled; fiction [only] manifests truth

FV.content: certain psychoanalytic interpretations (invisible framing: frame w/in frame) vs. scene of writing w/ ruined (abîmé) limits
FV.linkedContent: certain psychoanalytic interpretations (invisible framing: frame w/in frame) vs. scene of writing w/ ruined (abîmé) limits

FV.content: mise en abyme of title [The Purloined…]: the text is the object
FV.linkedContent: mise en abyme of title [The Purloined…]: the text is the object
